description:
Although we’re still two days away from the opening ceremony of the Paris 2024 Olympic Games, the action got underway today with the men’s football and rugby sevens tournaments kicking off. And tomorrow, Brazil will make its debut in this year’s Games, with four events to keep an eye on. Marking another milestone for women […]

The post Brazil’s Olympic Games gets underway Thursday: what to watch appeared first on The Brazilian Report.
title: Brazil’s Olympic Games gets underway Thursday: what to watch

description:
Jair Bolsonaro took Brazilian institutions to the brink, but they resisted. A political scientist explains why he believes that happened

The post Explaining Brazil #302: Why hasn’t Brazilian democracy died? appeared first on The Brazilian Report.
title: Explaining Brazil #302: Why hasn’t Brazilian democracy died?

description:
Professor Carlos Pereira argues that features of Brazil's democracy ensured that Bolsonaro's authoritarianism never became a credible threat

title: Is Brazilian democracy stronger than we thought?

description:
The superintendent of Cade, Brazil’s antitrust watchdog, has approved Zamp’s acquisition of the assets comprising the Starbucks coffee chain in Brazil from SouthRock, a struggling holding company that filed for bankruptcy protection in late 2023. Competitors or other Cade board members have 15 days to challenge the deal before the approval becomes final. Zamp is […]

The post Antitrust watchdog close to clearing sale of Starbucks Brazil appeared first on The Brazilian Report.
title: Antitrust watchdog close to clearing sale of Starbucks Brazil
